Class Persistence

java.lang.Object
krystal.framework.database.persistence.Persistence
public class Persistence extends Object
Retrieval operations on Entity objects.

  • Method Details

    • promiseAll

      public <T> krystal.VirtualPromise<Stream<T>> promiseAll(Class<T> clazz, QueryExecutorInterface queryExecutor, @Nullable StatementModifiers modifiers, @Nullable T optionalDummyType)
      Get all persisted objects from the database of particular type. The class must declare empty (no arguments) constructor. Use QueryExecutorInterface for initial dependency injection. Use @Filter for filtering the loading query. Utilises VirtualPromise for fetching the data and parallel mapping of objects.
      Parameters:
      optionalDummyType - If provided, will be taken as source for invoked methods in query construction. With, i.e. additional Skip fields as parameters, you can set up different conditional outputs for key methods, like PersistenceInterface.getTable() or PersistenceInterface.getLoader().
      See Also:
      • @Loader
      • @Reader
      • @ReadOnly

    • promiseAll

      public <T> krystal.VirtualPromise<Stream<T>> promiseAll(Class<T> clazz, int atLeast, @NonNull @NonNull PersistenceFilters filters)
      Unless @Fresh or explicitly set false
      invalid reference 
      PersistenceFilters#isMemorized()
      , attempts to load atLeast number of objects from PersistenceMemory. If the number is not satisfied - loads elements from database with promiseAll(Class, QueryExecutorInterface, StatementModifiers, Object).
      Parameters:
      atLeast - If 0, then the method will load only from PersistenceMemory.
      See Also:
      • Fresh
      • Memorized
